DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis: Controlled hypothermia to 33.5C for 48 hours reduces the severity of critical illness in neonates with severe necrotizing enterocolitis.
DOC.brief_title: Therapeutic Controlled Hypothermia in the Treatment of Neonates With Severe Necrotizing Enterocolitis
DOC.criteria: weight at diagnosis > 700 grams confirmed NEC (Bell's stage II or III) radiological evidence of pneumatosis coli systemic compromise as defined by increase in ventilation requirement and/or requiring inotopic support
